title: The marked price of an article is Rs 800. A retailer buys it for Rs 540 after getting two successive discounts. The first discount is 25%. What is the second discount? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let M denotes the marked price of the given article. Let P1 & P2 denote the prices of the article after first & second discounts respectively. It is mentioned that the marked price of the given article is Rs 800. So we have M = 800 …… (1) It is mentioned that the first discount is 25%. So we have, P1 = (1 - 0.25)*M = 0.75*M = 0.75*800 [from (1)] or P1 = 600 …… (2) Let X% denotes the second discount. So we have, P2 = (1 - X/100)*P1 = (1 - X/100)*600 [from (2)] It is mentioned that the price of the given article is Rs 540 after two successive discounts. So we have from above, (1 - X/100)*600 = P2 = 540 or 1 - X/100 = 540/600 = 0.9 or X/100 = 1 - 0.9 = 0.1 or X = 10 Therefore the second discount is 10%. [Ans]
second discount = 10% ANSWER: marked price=800 after giving 25% discount on 800 price = 800 - (25/100)*800 = 600 after giving x% discount on 600 price = 540 600 - (x/100)*600 = 540 x=10%
Marked price = ₹800 Discounted price = ₹540 Price after first discount = 800 * 75/100 = ₹600 Hence second discount = 600 - 540 = ₹60 Discount in percentage = 60/600 * 100 = 10
Let 1-x be the second discount 800*0.75*x=540 x=540/600=0.9 1-x=0.10 or 10% second discount (To verify, 800*0.75=600 & 600*0.9=540)
